publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2260 Miss Annabel Goldie: Rural Economy-That the Parliament notes the economic challenges confronting the rural and more remote parts of Scotland and recognises the specific implications of the Aggregates Tax for the quarrying industry in those areas.
S1M-2260 Rural Economy (lodged on 26 September 2001) John Scott*

S1M-2260 Miss Annabel Goldie: Rural Economy-That the Parliament notes the economic challenges confronting the rural and more remote parts of Scotland and recognises the specific implications of the Aggregates Tax for the quarrying industry in those areas. Supported by: John Scott
S1M-2260 Rural Economy (lodged on 26 September 2001) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2260 Rural Economy (lodged on 26 September 2001) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-2260 Rural Economy (lodged on 26 September 2001) Mary Scanlon*, David Mundell*
